intro: Orthospermum bonus-henricus, commonly known as the yellow scabious, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in grasslands, meadows, and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine, white hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
